alert.note: Alert for Eastern Black Range Foothills; Sierra County Lakes; Southern Gila Foothills, Mimbres Valley; Southern Gila Highlands, Black Range (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued June 03 at 2:35PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM MDT SATURDAY... The New Mexico Departments of Health and Environment has issued an Air Quality Alert, until 1 PM MDT Saturday. An Air Quality Alert for Smoke has been issued. * WHAT... Localized areas of unhealthy air quality will continue for areas near the black fire in the Gila National Forest. New and residual smoke here will be transported toward the east later today and into the evening with less impacts with westward extent. Smoke will likely become more visible from Truth or Consequences northward during the next 24 hours. Outside of the immediate Black fire area, smoke impacts to the state are not expected to be widespread or significant. * WHERE... Significant impacts will be focused across western Socorro, Catron, northeast Grant, and far western Sierra counties. More details on impacted locations and latest air quality information can be found at https://fire.airnow.gov. * WHEN... Now through at least 1PM MDT Saturday, June 4.
